sections.heading: Introduction to social prescribing

subsections.heading: Being ready:incorporating social prescribing into your practice2,4-6

sections.summary: Social prescribing is a practical way for health professionals to address social determinants of health by connecting people with a range of resources that support their social, mental and physical well-being. It expands the options available in primary care and connects people to non-clinical services and programs in the community to improve their health and well-being. sections.heading: Assess and understand the social factors impacting health
sections.summary: Through discussion with individuals, assess their needs to understand how social determinants of health may be affecting their well-being. It is important to block off time for open-ended conversations to discuss their needs. Document identified social determinants of health in the individual’s health record (e.g., in the CPP).1,2,4,6 Lead with empathy and create a safe space for all– Remember that everyone comes with a unique social story. sections.heading: After social prescribing: follow-up and follow through
sections.summary: After initiating a social prescription, be diligent in scheduling a follow-up appointment(s) to check-in on its effectiveness. Just like other prescriptions and referrals, best practice in social prescribing requires follow-up. Be sure to emphasize to the individual that their social needs are equally as important as their medical ones.
